text: We were so very pleased with the service we received from Sunshine Satellites. They were prompt and resolved our issue quickly. Jason our technician was great as well. We highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thank you very very much!!! Glad we could assist everything!

text: This company really exceeded my expectations!! Great work turning my Gameroom 🎮 in my paradise!

text:
Efficient, knowledgeable, great service.
Best in the business!! By far.

resp.text: Thank you sir!!

text: I was very happy with the service we received from this company.  We were having issues with our RV satellite system and they were able to diagnose and repair the issue.  We would definitely recommend this company.

resp.text: Thanks for the business!!

name: Steve Agrecy
text: Great service - after the sale.  Had connection issues, SUNSHINE SAT worked with each of my components to help me troubleshoot - very satisfied.  Would buy from them again....

resp.text: Happy to  help anytime, glade you are up and working! Thanks for your business!

name: Jo Anne Cothran
text:
I can't say enough good things about my experience with Sunshine Satellites  in Foley, Alabama!! From the very first call I made to them, the friendliest and most energetic reception was overwhelming!
All their staff have excellent communication skills and are knowledgeable of all product and services.
I highly recommend this company to meet your satellite and internet needs!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for using your Local Dish Network Retailer !!

name: Rick Danish
text: My Dish installation was fast and professional. The technician was very helpful and took extra time to explain and teach me how to use all the features on the remote. I highly recommend Sunshine Satellites for satellite TV installation and service.

resp.text: Thank you Mr.Danish for the local business.

name: Eric Fontaine
text: Sunshine satellites has been the best. I’ve had to call for a service call and the sweet lady that answered the phone had someone out within 2 hours. Daryl who did the work was amazing and went above and beyond to fix the problem. I called back several weeks later to see about getting some TV hung inside the home and next day they were being hung. Strongly recommended!!!

resp.text: Thank you sir!! Tracy was the sweet lady @ the office, we appreciate your business and all the referrals you have sent to us that means alot.

name: Richard Bonds
text: Daryl and his staff were always nice and very caring!  They did a great job and was reasonable with their pricing!  I would highly recommend their services to anyone!  I don’t believe that you would go wrong!

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Bonds it was a pleasure meeting you and for shopping local with us. Thank You !!

text:

resp.text: Thank you Ryan

name: Jennifer Clemmons
text: Went to turn in my equipment,  there we 2 employees and each had a customer.  I'm holding the medium sized box with one arm in a cast. No one spoke to me. Finally I put the box on a table and waited for my turn. One employee left the room and came back with the manager (?). She apologized for my wait and proceeded to scan my equipment. I was 2 days late returning it and got a bill for $223. I asked her if she could prorate it for just 2 days. She smiled  and told me the charge would be credited back to me within 24 hours. She was very nice and appreciative about how I boxed the equipment.  It was a good enough experience even with my arm in a cast. I left happy and the only reason I disconnected our cable and internet was because we don't really watch TV much anymore.  Our internet was iffy at best. You could work on your phone but if you moved or turned over it had to think about it too often and long. I got a move- in special for 1 year. Each service was $44.99.

name: Beth Glover
text: Jana Burks at the Dothan Spectrum store made my equipment exchange easy and non painful. She was very friendly and professional. I was in and out in under 10 minutes.

name: Karen Creel
text: Service was awesome!! Thanks y'all!! We're absolutely loving our WIfi. Only issue I have had is navigating the website & app. The error message states unavailable in my area or something to that nature.

name: Brian Parker
text: Extremely helpful staff. Came in to get one thing, ended up with more for a lower price than advertised. No issues at all, unless you're a anti-masker!🤣

name: Debra Deas
text: Well a 10 wouldn't be good enough. How about a rate of 20. Very good and patient reps.

name: Victor Parker
text: So far so good with spectrum.

name: Mark Leonard
text: Excellent customer service.  Staff very knowledgeable & helpful.

name: Jamie Andrews
text: Waited 45 min was told I had to wear a mask but other people were not got tired of waiting just left worst experience ever

name: King Shawn
text: Customer service is automated, and PATHETIC! Hangs up on you. This company is HORRIBLE!

name: Shanda Roberts
text: Great customer service!

text: Clean,professional and Friendly!!

name: Jamesdean Hudson
text: Very helpful

name: Trace Patrick
text: Awful people.

name: Tesa Hood
text: Awful service!

text: They very professional have good products and that's what is all about nowadays and the service is outstanding

name: Tim
text: Waited 30 mins for store to open. Left and came back. It's now 1:05 and still no one. Guess I'll get to make another 30 min trip this coming week.

name: Esmeralda Paap
text: Went to drop off my spectrum cable box and router today and the staff was very nice and helped me in a quick and timely manner.

name: geanna gray
text: I swapped out my old modem for a updated model. There was no wait time in line. someone greeted me and started processing the equipment immediately. Friendly environment and I was out in no time👍🏾

name: Kiwi Pettway
text: The young man was very helpful and friendly.

name: Geoff Brown
text: No help whatever just a place to exchange equipment

name: Tammy “POSSUM” Bullock
text: Nice store...nice staff

name: Scott Smith
text: Great customer service!

name: Marty patterson
text:
Can't contact anyone about service
and wi-fi is very slow and not reliable

name: Rachel Sims
text: Worst customer service EVER. Line has been cut in my yard for a week, trip calling 911. Numerous calls, they all say someone will be out on a certain day and NO ONE SHOWS UP and a ticket is never created for the service. Even spoke to a supervisor and she lied to my face saying she called the local office and they will be out. The next day when no one showed up a different supervisor told me they don't call local offices. No one does their job there. Here I on the 5th service call.. TBD if they show. AVOID.

name: James Montgomery
text: Replaced lines in back yard, left cut trees and limbs all over my back yard for me to clean up, I don't use Windstream and haven't because of the terrible service. Now on top of working 7 days a week I get to come home and clean up after them. Terrible service, no way to treat a land owner!!

name: Jesse Wadsworth Jr
text: The company contracted out which is Excelerate is not a company I would recommend. They are not professional in wiring as they only hook a computer up and check the wires as I have a tester and it shows something is still wrong. The company excelerate needs to be disconnected with windstream as they have tons of bad reviews.

name: Coach Corey
text: The worst wifi and communication in America I advise you if you stay anywhere near they services please move somewhere else

name: C C
text: I have been a customer for over 12 yrs  and not had major issues with my business although in the last 24 hrs they have given me a reason to doubt them. No communication for 24 hours...i have been put on hold for over 4 hours . This is my telephone system for my office. Hard to do business without service.  I will not go through this in the future because I will have local company that can handle.

name: Angeloty Porter
text: This is not just the worst internet you can have but the worst of any service period you will ever know. Rude is an understatement for there costumer service. You are lucky to get 5 mega bytes of download speed if you have the highest and most expensive service. I called to complain and they said they were sending someone between 8am and 7 pm lol really? So around 2 pm I called for an update and they said they had cancelled because " they looked and we had a lot of devices streaming. They never even let us know they cancelled. We never have good service and it goes completely out half of the time. No wonder they are bankrupt. You are better off getting a good phone getting unlimited data and getting a good mobile hotspot app. I promise you will hate you did business with this horrible company.

name: Kathryn B
text:
Would rate zero if it was a possibility. I'm assuming the lack of service starts at the top, so I'll just say if you have a different alternative for where you live, choose it.
Disgraceful and poorly run company.

name: Cathy Reid
text: WORST INTERNET SERVICE EVER! How does this company even stay in business? You only got one star because it MADE me click on it to be able to post. You get absolutely ZERO stars!

name: Bart Pierce
text: What can I say, they never show up when they say they will. They don't call and let you know they won't show up. When you ask them why you are having the particular issue you are having with their service they put you on hold for an average of 30 min and depending on who you speak to each time, they tell you different reasons. Hands down the worst company I have ever dealt with. It's as if my internet provider is run by federal bureaucrats. If I could, I would give them a negative five stars. I am now going to the better business bureau website to file a complaint.

name: Kristyn Hanvey
text: The ONLY reason they get a star is because you have to click something!! WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!! After 2 days of a no show technician to set up my internet I call to find out the same BS excuse of not coming was a "stalled train" on the tracks. ( which was a lie on both accounts). When I called BS & voiced my concern about getting my service, the customer service rep LAUGHED!!!!  I requested to speak to a supervisor and was put on indefinite hold!!!! Unfortunately this is the only provider in my area.....  HORRIBLE

name: Allen Norris
text:
Update- It's been 2 years since I posted my initial review for Windstream and still nothing has changed. They offered me a "speed upgrade" from the 15Mbps we were initially given to 25 Mbps for the same price and sent a tech out to do some work and replace our modem. Instead of an upgrade we now consistently get less than 10Mbps and earlier today a speedtest showed around 1Mbps. I wouldn't even call this high speed out here and according to the currently accepted definition it isn't. 25Mbps is. Still no Spectrum but Hargray which isn't a huge company or rated too much better is 9 power poles away from our house and has scheduled to finish expanding towards our house but their minimum they offer is 100Mbps on an actual fiber optic line. I talked to a Windstream installer about it and he told me that he and other installers have talked to the people at Windstream in charge of expanding their network and upgrading it about upgrading our part of the street to fiber because it is literally on our street already and he said they laughed and said they don't any plans to ever upgrade any more in our area and are just going to leave the lines as they are and if they deteriorate and cause signal problems oh well not their problem. That's great business right there. Don't support your products until they fall apart and just tell your customers oh well sorry. This perfectly explains why Windstream had to file bankruptcy and their hemorrhaging customers more than any other provider. I wouldn't be surprised if they go completely out of business by years end.
Absolutely the worst internet provider that I have ever used in my life. We are stuck with them because they are the only provider other than going satellite internet which would be just as bad in our area. I know not only myself have complained but numerous other families have complained about their service and there's even lawyers out her handling arbitrations against them because they are so bad. They don't care to fix their infrastructure because they know we have no other options available to us because we're in such a rural area. I have heard recently though that our small City passed an ordinance that will force them to upgrade the infrastructure out here so maybe that will help. Either that or maybe Spectrum who is now roughly a mile away all the way around us will finally reach our house soon. I'm hoping for the latter so I can do away with horrible over priced Windstream.

name: Brittany Sullivan
text:
Call on Friday to make order for internet and WiFi, we'll call or text to let you know we will be coming, they show up on Monday (no call or text) install the exterior work and leave a card that it's working properly, BUT no modem. So therefore I have no WiFi no internet, it's now Thursday still no modem delivered, and their office says there is no modem, pass you to another rep that says there is an order, pass to the next rep ...I'll ship you another modem...what? I didn't even get the 1st one. Where is your office I will come get one, ....she says I don't know where the warehouse is. Hmmm....🤔 So how many more days will I have to wait? It could be Saturday or Monday before you get the modem. Wow!!! Absolutely Wow!!! In 2 calls I have spoken to 9 people who have no clue as to what they are doing or what their co-workers have done within the order. No communication with each other and absolutely no communication with their customer's who are supposed to be #1.
Just activate that order so we can collect more money. Your company is piss poor and you should close and lock the doors. And yes you will credit our account for the 8 days we never had internet service. I CAN shut down my contribution to your income real quick!!! And the one star was earned not by my satisfaction but because you did answer the phone for a sale. That's all you see in a customer is their money.

text: There is no information regarding how to end services on their website, and when I called the tech told me she doesn’t know how it works, couldn’t direct me to the info online, couldn’t email me to provide confirmation that I attempted to give notice to disconnect today, and couldn’t tell me anything other than “they’ll call me later.” The internet service has been spotty and honestly the whole call and lack of info seems super sketchy.

name: Robert Lashua
text:
I'm a new customer and have been impressed with ONELinkUSA's service.  I live on the Gulf Coast and I lost power for a few days after hurricane Sally.  As soon as the power was restored my ONELinkUSA service was available.  I'd hear reports on the radio estimating when service from some bigger Cable/Internet providers may be restored.  It impressed me that there was no interruption of my service.

I also had occasion to call their customer service shortly after moving in to address a minor issue.  My call was promptly answered by a real, friendly and helpful person who resolved my issue quickly.

name: Shaniqua Martin
text: ONELinkUSA staff are amazing and extremely responsive. I am glad that I have them and the quality is good and it's so refreshing that I don't have to watch my data like most places.

name: Alex Kupisz
text: The install was Quick & professional, the service works great! Joe Brister was our installation rep & he is polite, patient, & professional, he is an outstanding member of your team. From what I'm hearing in the community-everyone loves this guy!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your 5 star review and kind words. We are fortunate to have fantastic, personable employees and Joe is one of the top!

name: Scarlet Meadows
text: I have had internet and cable with One Link for 5 months. The service and value have been excellent. Only a few times have I lost service and they responded quickly and had it back up very fast. I highly recommend OneLink!

resp.text: Scarlet, ONELinkUSA knows how important it is to stay connected to YOUR World! We appreciate the 5 star review and the wonderful comments!

name: Graham Mitchell
text: Very friendly staff and fast communication. Installer was very pleasant and on time. He also stayed until he was sure everything was functioning with my wireless router, which he did not have to do. The follow up calls about my experience were also very nice. I have found this group to be way more engaging than Cox communications, who I would give a 1 star at this point.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear of the times that our technicians go above and beyond for our customers. We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review. Thank you so much!!

name: Jay Dunston
text: First off the customer service team is very polite. Even when I'm so upset at how bad the service is, I can never be mad at the customer service cause they are so nice. But aside from that, the service is awful! Ive had OneLink USA for a year now and there are outages every week for several minutes to several hours. Speeds are inconsistent. I pay for 100mbps and rarely come near that. If I do, it doesn't last long before another outage. My wife works from home and I have been as well for the past few months and we had to by a Hotspot about 2 months into using OneLink because the service is just so unreliable. I can't wait to move out of my apartment so I can get back to decent reliable service and not have to pay twice as much just to get a Hotspot so my wife can work.

name: Wanda Beal
text: Great service from the first phone call until the technician completed my set up.  This is my first time living in an apartment so I had my line set up then decided to move it to another location.  It was no problem - they set an appointment for another technician visit and it was the same guy (sorry I forgot his name) .  He was very patient and helpful while explaining things to me.  System set up is working great.

resp.text: Thank you Wanda for your review. Congratulations on your first apartment! We are happy to have made your moving experience a little easier. We do have dedicated property service technicians to offer another level of comfort when you need assistance. Call us anytime. Our phones are answered by a LIVE customer service representative!

name: Christopher Harris
text: Worst internet provider I've ever experienced. In regards to internet speed the internet is non-existent. If you call the help desk they will "reset" your motem/ router and then tell you to unplug for a minute and then replug. Next thing you know still no internet? Paying for 50 megabytes and receiving 0? Seems like a scam for a business. Wish there was an option for a negative rating.

name: Sarah Tran
text: VERY easy to work with and very responsive with requests. Sometimes our internet speeds don't get as high as advertised, but we do live in a crowded internet area (apartments), but can't beat the price. Overall satisfied. And the technicians are always so professional andwand polite when they come by! It's nice to work with a company run by real, honest people.

resp.text: Wow Sarah, such nice words for our team and company! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review.

name: Debbie Helmke
text: Everyone is really great and easy to talk to. The only complaint I have is that they only come to my apartment complex on certain days. So if you go out on a Monday, they don’t come out until Tuesday. And I’ve gone out on the weekend and they don’t come out until Tuesday. They do give you credit for all days you are out.

resp.text: Debbie, thank you so much for your feedback. Having the same property service technicians at each property does allow for familiarity for/with residents. As always, a sense of urgency is top priority!

text:
I didnot have much complaints till recently. Yes internet connection comes and goes randomly at times but it didnot bother me till recently. In the past 2 months, the connection constantly comes and goes during day. 1-2 h of daily outage is typical. The issue is it makes it impossible to do any type of work once you have unreliable internet connection. I m moving out soon so not planning to change it but the lesson is learned, no more onlelink usa. I gave them 2 stars because people at customer service are really nice and try to be helpful.

I m updating my initial review. I give them 1 star but i doubth they deserve that much. Today is june 6 and since 8 am i trying to do very light internet media consumption and thanks to one linkusa it is not working. I m so glad i ll get rid of this company soon

resp.text: We understand that excellent customer service and technical superiority is paramount for complete satisfaction. We are committed to providing consistent, reliable internet service. name: Marilyn
text: The customer service is stupendous! Never a computer to get through when calling, always a real person. They’re very kind and respectful, and super accommodating. If I ever move from my apartments, I hope to find another place that has Onelink USA!!

resp.text: Marilyn, your feedback is very much appreciated. Thank you for taking the time and for your encouraging words. Real People, Real Service... That is what ONELinkUSA is all about!

text: They went above and beyond to make sure I was set-up with internet and cable on they day they committed to. The tech stayed late (till 8:30pm) to make sure everything was working properly. Everyone was super polite.

name: Yuri Popok
text: Cheap base package. WiFi upload ~ 2-3 Gb/s, TV picture is of very pure quality.

resp.text: Our goal at ONELinkUSA is to offer the highest quality and fastest speeds. Feel free to email us at info@onelinkusa.com with additional information regarding your experience.

name: Jasmine Pochynok
text: Please consider other options, especially if you need internet access to work from home or take online classes. This isn't a review about customer service, the team is nice. But I pay to have consistent, reliable internet service at home and ONELink does not provide that.

resp.text: Jasmine, we do offer upgraded packages outside of our complimentary speeds that do work better for online classes or working from home. Please give us a call at 800.721.1710 and allow a customer service representative go over options with you.

name: Sarah Mixon
text: Honestly, there's only good things that I can say about ONELink. I use to have Cox, but I was always having issues with the connection dropping or going a full day where the internet was down. It was a constant battle. When I moved to a different complex, I was set up with ONELink and I can honestly say that it's been a great experience. It's cheaper than every other internet provider out there, so you're saving money, but you're also getting excellent service. I have yet to have an outage or a day without internet since using it the past few months. They come out personally, free of charge, to set everything up for you and provide everything you need. The installation guy that I got was super friendly and was very quick and professional about it. The internet is super fast, and as a video gamer this was incredibly important to me. No need for fiber internet, because I've got ONELink!

resp.text: Sarah, your comments are very much appreciated. Our team works hard to provide exceptional service. Thank you for your words and the 5 star rating!

name: gingerpower52
text: You get what you pay for i suppose, average customer service, average connection. But OneLink is good enough.

resp.text: While we do appreciate your review, we strive to be above average. Please send us an email at info@onelinkusa.com to let us know how we can exceed your expectations.

name: waffleandchicken
text: It’s a fibre based service that contends with the local monopolies. It may not be perfect (occasional short outages, and occasional low speeds at peak times) but, the employees and the technicians are fantastic and the prices are some of the best in the area. For a smaller ISP, they really do a good job, and being able to talk to a human rather than a 30 minute answering machine prompt is near priceless.

resp.text: Real People, Real Service. Faster Speeds, Better Prices. More Channels, more choices are things which make OneLinkUSA different than our competition. We appreciate your feedback!

name: Diane Karloff

I wish they had the same reliability as prior to Dec 2018, than I would give it 4 to 5 stars as pricing and customer service is acceptable.

text: Customer service is nice. That's about it. Constantly internet in and out. Any no reason for it. Have had to many people come to fix it and seems no better... Never had so many issues before with any other companies... Unf stuck til my community management change  providers again.

name: Ray Martinez
text: Excellent customer service; quick replies via email about my situation.

resp.text: We appreciate your review. We do take every customer situation with a sense of urgency that we aim to resolve. Our customer service representatives are available 7 days a week to provide quick and courteous support to our residents. Thank you for being a ONELinkUSA customer!

name: Mark Davis
text:
So you call the number on their website, and the person you talk to has absolutely no information or power. They're very polite, but not really helpful. They take your information and send a message so someone will call you later. If I wanted someone to call me later, I would've sent an email. I call because I want an answer immediately.

"I need to know my account number" "I don't have that information, but someone will give you a call soon." "So, tonight? or tomorrow?" "I can't give estimates on when they'll get back to you." Awesome.

name: Luke Hoerning
text:
This is without a doubt the worst internet provider I have ever had, unfortunately I have no other options because they are the only internet provider available in my apartment complex. The internet is down more often than it works, sometimes for minutes, sometimes for hours, and sometimes for days. Recently I was completely without internet for over a week. Usually it just goes back and forth between connecting and disconnecting, and most days I get less than 1/3 of the 100 Mbps speeds I pay for for the few minutes it is working. Since moving here less than two months ago, I have spoken with OneLink more than 15 times in an attempt to get any kind of resolution to this, and they have yet to do anything to fix it. If you have a choice, do not sign up for OneLink, try Cox or AT&T instead. I can attest to the fact that both of those providers actually care about customer service and provide fast reliable internet. All that OneLink provides is constant frustration.

Edit: I appreciate the response, but as of today, September 18 2019, I am still only receiving an average download speed of 5 Mbps. Considering I pay for 100 Mbps I would not consider this issue resolved.

resp.text: Luke, we agree that the service has been less than desirable. An unexpected test from Mother Nature was experienced that left us in a predicament.  Many lessons were learned. We appreciate you hanging in there with us as we worked to get this issue resolved at your apartment complex. Your experience with ONELink is anticipated to be better than ever. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Leah Ledford
text:
Every month they call to say I haven't paid my bill and every month I tell them to turn it on automatic and they don't. EVERY MONTH. This month the wifi was just shut off and when I called to find out why it's because "i DiDnT pAy My bIlL". So we go through the process again. I pay over the phone again. Then, wildly two days later my wifi IS STILL OFF.
If you have the opportunity to avoid using this company I would strongly recommend that.

resp.text: Thank you, Leah, for your feedback. Automatic payments are deducted on the 1st of every month. We do conduct courtesy calls every month for the accounts that still show a balance after that date.  The courtesy calls are seen as above and beyond customer service for most since the goal is to keep service uninterrupted. We can tag your account as a "do not call account" upon your request. Please call us at 800.721.1710 or email us at info@onelinkusa.com to have this added to your account.

name: Christopher Epperson
text:
EDIT: My internet is back up (kinda) but it's doing the same thing it was before. I called their customer support who said they would call me right back after speaking to their tech people... And they never did! Don't waste your time with these people.

ORIGINAL POST: Customer service is nice and friendly, but that's the only positive thing I can say. My internet speed has been at most 80% of what I pay for when nobody else is using it,  and normally hovers around 50%-60%, with an upload speed of 1mpbs... When it works. Most of the time it's out or so slow it may as well be out. The ping is so jittery that it makes gaming impossible as it will jump from 60ms to 2000ms or more, on a wired connection.

So far they say that the reason why it is not working is because the server is being replaced, but I was originally told it would be done I think a month ago when I they first installed their equipment. Now it was supposed to be done last night but they're still working on it almost 24 hours later... Since then my internet has been completely out, which is worse since it is the first week of school and now I can't do any classwork.

They say they will reimburse me on my next bill but nobody's said how much it will be yet. I'm honestly expecting something pathetic like 10 bucks... Personally I feel like I should have a full refund for the time that I have spent dealing with it so far.

My advice: if you have the option to use any other ISP, use them instead. Your internet will probably work and hopefully won't take a month to start working properly.

resp.text: We agree that the service has been less than desirable at your apartment complex. An unexpected test from Mother Nature was experienced that left us in a predicament. Many lessons were learned. We appreciate you hanging in there with us as we worked to get this issue resolved. You will find your experience has greatly improved. Thank you for your feedback!

name: Kayla Greathouse
text: I had a problem with my internet and they were here the next day to fix it. The guy took less then 5 minutes to fix the problem! Awesome service

resp.text: Fantastic Kayla! We take every situation with a sense of urgency. Our dedicated property service technicians are familiar with each community we service and aim to provide residents with a level of comfortableness and confidence. Thank you so much for taking the time to leave a review!

name: Austin Dale
text:
DO NOT use onelink. The internet service is absolutely appalling, will constantly go out or dip well well below the speeds you're buying.

The lady on the phone is absolutely useless, she can't give you any information. Need your account number? Too bad she doesnt know. Need to know when your bills due? Too bad she doesnt know.

They have 0 customer service skills. They are only there for good inquiries, any negative calls will result in them rushing you off the phone promising to fix the problem. But they can't, their service is horrible and they can't fix it.

I just said screw it and went with cox but this company is STILL charging me for this months internet. AND I HAVEN'T USED A SINGLE DAY THIS MONTH YET. She said it is in my contract but guess what, I DONT EVEN HAVE MY ACCOUNT NUMBER. How would I know any information regarding the service if you refuse to send me a contract, or at the very least, MY ACCOUNT NUMBER. Ridiculous.

It is a scam. They lock apartments in with cheap contracts and coast off of that. If they would sell to individuals only this company would be out of business in months.

Again, DO NOT use onelinkusa.

resp.text: Exceptional customer service is a priority for ONELinkUSA. We answer all calls with a LIVE representative instead of using computer prompts. Individual account information is confidential and is readily available for the account owner.  We are disappointed in your departure and wish you well with your new provider.  Thank you for your feedback!

name: Edith Chavez
text:
I have been with several different internet providers and Onelink USA is by far the worst I have had. The internet goes out all the time and nobody can ever find a fix. I replace all of one links equipment with my own and still no good indicating the problem lies within onelink itself. Terrible service and over priced please stay far away and use COX. COX is not the great service but hey you will at least have internet. With onelink you pay them a monthly fee for 0 service in return.

Newly Updated: It has been a week since this review was written and just want to provide an accurate update. My internet is now online; however, my 100 Mps speed is averaging 1-3 Mbps.

resp.text: Edith, we apologize for your experience. Sometimes an unprecedented event shines light on learned lessons. ONELinkUSA does provide exceptional customer service and our technical team is top notch. We look forward to your return business. Thank you for your feedback!

name: Doug Brown
text: BLUF: Great customer service! I will say it is not the most consistent internet out there however it is a pretty good deal for the cost! The internet tech or team member Dion, was incredibly professional and knowledgeable, and he fixed our problem quickly!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to leave a review. We are extremely appreciative of our staff and their dedication to customer service. Our calls are answered by a live customer service representative therefore reaching someone quickly is never an issue. We will be sure to pass along your comments to Dion!

name: damon mccann
text: Very courteous, prompt and knowledgeable.  Great Service!

name: Nathan Edwards

resp.text: ONELinkUSA is committed to providing excellent service. We apolgize that you left with a bad taste for our company. We have onsite, dedicated property technicians that work hard to make sure all residents are enjoying the service they need. We can always be reached at 800.721.1710.

text:

text: Terrible experience with the internet service. When it works, it works great. The problem is that it rarely ever works at the speeds that it is supposed to. text: This company is a horrible, rude and disrespectful called many times to get things fixed like enternet keeps going out or ports open on the modem to allow some of my equipment to get open connection to the internet( its been 2 weeks since ive called and they have yet to fix the situation or give me a call back( for those who dont know about ports, it can literally take 5 mintues to do it)). name: Erica theesfeld
text: Love this company

name: Gregory Demaree
text: Good people!!!

name: Devin Newman
text:
Update from my past review as of 7/26/2021...

A representative contacted me a while ago and asked me to send regular ping reports and trace routes to help resolve the issue, which i was more than happy to do. I did as I was asked for a few weeks and it seemed like the problem was only getting worse. PB refuses to upgrade their equipment, even when they know they cant sustain their entire customer base with the current equipment that they have. Their customer service team is on point, and deserves the praise. however, fire your upper management. they have no idea what they are doing and refuse to spend the money to keep their customer base happy or at least not cursing them every time they attempt to use the internet between the hours of 7 and 10. i would switch if there was anyone else offering internet service in my area but unfortunately I'm stuck with you guys. yippee. As for the "response from the owner", I don't need it. I don't need another service call, I have identified the problem and the problem is you. issue a tech ticket on that buddy. maybe someone with the knowledge to fix the problems that the company is facing, and the selflessness to fix the branch's budget to upgrade the equipment can take your position and make PB great again. work it back to its former glory. until then, the service they offer is not worth the money if you intend to game between the hours of 7 and 10. I've said my peace. BTW, stop trying to boost  your rating with fake reviews. I grew up on a farm, I know BS when I see it. Cheers.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about your experience, Devin, but the feedback is appreciated. A manager will look into this for you and schedule a service call.

text: PB is not reliable at all!! I pay way to much for tv service for it to be constantly freezing or blacking out! I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone

text:

Because they are not one of the larger national ISPs, I believe they lack the technical expertise to set up their external equipment and to test and resolve issues such as these.  They have been to my home twice for several hours each time and have supposedly been working on the issue at their offices as well.  This has been ongoing for a couple of months with no resolution as of yet.
They need to provide a list of devices with known issues with their service when marketing to new customers.

text: Constantly drops connection and slows below 20% of the package speed that I am paying for. The only plus is how friendly and responsive their customer service is, although the problem still has persisted for months.

text: If there was a way to rate Point Broadband Zero (0.0) Stars I would do it.  The TV service is unreliable.  I currently have several channels that are just a blank/black screen.  I have spoken with Tech support and Customer Service which are both absolutely no help. They are a aware of the issue and "working to resolve it as it is a widespread outage" however, they have no timeframe of when it will be resolved. The channels have been out for several days.  Now, since I have been paying my bill onetime religiously for a number of years, it pains me to think of the money wasted on substandard service such as this.  I asked customer service about a credit but they do not want to issue one.  That says a lot about this company. "take the money but don't give the customer what they pay for". This place is horrible.  Do not waste your time with them.

name: Russell Speir
text:
I have issued several support tickets with Point Broadband over the time that they took control of the fiber infrastructure from the city of Opelika. I don't believe I ever even needed support when the city ran it.

When they did send a tech out last year for constant internet droppages and timeouts one of the techs didn't plug everything back in the outside panel when he left and I had to get them back out here. They still never resolved the original problem which they say they said they really had no idea how to resolve.

I'd grappled with consistent and ongoing connectivity and bandwidth issues for a while and support was hit or miss. I wouldn't say that they were dismissive but I definitely felt like I was swept under the rug for months.

Following a very poor review once I'd finally reached the end of my rope (after over a year of poor performance, this wasn't a decision I made overnight) my issue was finally made a priority and support worked with newly found purpose to reach a conclusion and resolve my issue once and for all.

I finally felt like they were working in pursuit of my best interests and put their best effort forward to exhaust any potential issues on their and my end.

Unlike any previous service appointment, the newly appointed technician did notice an anomaly originating from within my home which was not allowing ample bandwidth to the devices inside of the home, but that bandwidth did appear nominal up to my home.

Thankfully, with the new help and previously absent coordination of support staff to deduce the origin of the issue, I was able to trace the problem to both a faulty connection from the ethernet port to the PCB inside of my router and a portion of old ethernet cable which I suspect was not sufficiently shielded or hearty enough to support such high bandwidth.

Although my issues appear to have originated from outside Point Broadbands scope I felt that their support staffs lax approach to reach a resolution for such an extended period of time allowed continued and needless frustration on my part.

I'm thankful to whoever the technician was that they sent onsite that recognized an issue from within the home, the guy who organized the response, and the lady that walked through a number of different tests with me over the phone.

It turns out I just needed a little more effort I felt like I was afforded for so long.

resp.text: Russell, We’re so sorry to hear you had a disappointing experience. We strive to provide the best possible service and support and apprently we fell short.  A representative will be in touch today to schedule an onsite service call.  Your Internet speeds are unacceptable and we will resolve this issue to your satisfaction. We appreciate your business and patience.

name: Nancy Murphy
text: Terrible cable service, and even after you report the problems, it only gets worse. Nothing ever improves. Very expensive and the worst! Update 8/2/2021 Still terrible service, too high price

resp.text: Hi Nancy, so sorry to hear about your experience. We have had issues with certain cable networks in the last few weeks but all should be working as normal today. A representative will be contacting you shortly to discuss your service issues.

name: Robert Franklin
text: I wish I could post zero stars. It’s a different excuse every single night for two weeks... Hurricane came though & upgrades haven’t been completed, maybe there’s some type of atmospheric interference, blah blah blah. Tech comes out & “fixes broadband”. Goes down every single night. Don’t waste your money with this company. Even call customer service & she “can’t locate my account by name, address, or account number. Account# 2387 for your reference point broadband.

text: I am so disappointed. My bill has increased several times, yet I’ve lost several channels from my original package. name: ozz calton
text: Johnny on the Spot, does what they say there'll do  !!!

name: James Joyce
text:
Pros: US-based service, all-fiber network in Opelika, not Charter
Cons: asymmetric plans (come on now, it's FTTP), some internal systems are spotty, bogus fees on bill

Update 11/30: Point has begun passing on their 3.5% revenue share to the city of Opelika to customers. This is garbage - what you owe Opelika as a part of your franchise agreement is your problem, not ours. Jacking up our bills by that amount is just a way to weasel out of the agreements you've already made with us. Docking a star for the Charter-esque slime. Do better.

I'm not a TV customer with Point and never will be, so I can't comment on the issues the other reviewers have had with that. I am an internet customer, and that seems to have been rock solid. As an IT professional, I appreciate reaching knowledgeable people in tech support on the first try - no script reading, actual have the tools and skills to fix things, or the ability to directly put in tickets with the people who do. A note: if you need a real public IP address, you can request one for free. Otherwise, you'll be behind CGNAT, which is fine for most people.

Point, please come to Auburn soon!

name: Carla Blatt
text: Several channels freeze all the time!!!!!   Have called numerous times only to be told "we are aware of the issue, we have had lots of calls, it freezes here too. We hope to get the issue resolved."  I have been a customer since this compamy started in Opelika, when it was actually good...never had any problems.  NOW, its terrible! freezes, looses signal, customer service that is now in West Point, GA is no help at all. I pay $150 per month which is alot but when the service was good, I didnt mind paying it. Now that there seems to be an ongoing problem with no explanation or a timeframe of fixing the problem, I am shopping for new service.

resp.text: Hi Carla, thank you for your comments. We apologize for the recent issues on some of our video channels and we are working diligently to resolve the problem.  A service representative will be in touch with you shortly. We also are frustrated with the cost of cable programming that the cable channels continue to charge,  The good news is there is now a better way to watch tv.! It's called Streaming, and offers a lower cost and a better experience. You can learn more at https://point-broadband.com/streaming/.

text: I had a great experience with Point's customer service team!

If you could make arrangements for someone to be home on a Tuesday or Thursday we would be happy to schedule your install. Sorry for any inconvenience. Please call us at 844-40-POINT.

name: Toast McGoats
text:
This ISP was great when it was owned by the City of Opelika.  The infrastructure was sold to Point Broadband.  Ever since, the service is spotty at best.  I've tried to work with them multiple times with issues but they always say that it's my hardware that is the problem.  I bought a new router, same problems.  I got their mesh WiFi using Plume, it might be worse now.  At this point, I'm looking for a new ISP.

If you're looking for an ISP, I would shop around.  I used to recommend this company to everyone 100%, but not anymore.

resp.text: Toast, we do not have an account under your name? Could it possibly be under another name? We would like to assist you ASAP and resolve any service issues you are experiencing. Please contact us at 844-407-6468 or email us at https://point-broadband.com/contact/

name: Mayur Patel
text:
Updated:

I signed up with their 100 mbps internet fiber package for $39.99 a month. I was going to start the service on 9th January since it was Saturday. The lady who placed the order suggested to start on 8th January since 9th was Saturday and staff may not be available. This was not a new installation. All they had to do was flip the switch ON.

Turns out the internet was not turned ON on 8th. I called customer service and no one would pick up. Finally was able to get to technical support. She said the order was not executed by the lady who placed the order. Long story short after spending 8 hours between Friday to Sunday night talking to at least 10 folks, I got my service turned ON Sunday night. I had work Monday morning. I was out of internet for almost 3 days.

Now comes the billing. Received a bill for $103.48 on January 18th. Called customer service to understand why it was so high. Turns out they billed prorated for January and advance for February. That is fine. However, they billed at $59.99 a month instead of $39.99 a month for which I was signed up.

I quit. I would not recommend them for any business. Specifically their customer service team is absolutely HORRIBLE! The tech support team is much better.

No surprise, their reviews speak.

Old:

I decided to move to point broadband internet after speed issues with AT&T. The actual internet service is good so far. No speed issues.

As far as installation is concerned, their staff was good and courteous. The only recommendation is to give staff to use temp shoe covers when they enter house and be careful when they are inside. No one likes mess when they leave.

They need to really work on their employees sitting at the Opelika office answering phone calls. I had billing issues and called the office. Got in touch with an agent and it was a total waste of time. She cannot understand billing questions nor can answer anything. She was rude and acted like she didn't care to address the issues. Then I went to the office in the evening thinking I will quit with them and move back to AT&T.

But when I met Lakirah Tatum and discussed the billing issues, she understood right away and was able to address them quickly. She is smart and has great customer service skills. She is the reason I decided to continue with Point Broadband.

Thank you Lakirah for your help!

resp.text: Thank you for your comments and feedback. We will make sure that the leadership team is notified. Lakirah is one of our many superstars in customer service and we are so happy that you have decided to stay with our service. Thanks!

name: Loretta Allen
text: Awesome

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Linda Neil
text: Had the internet for 4 years.  First 2 years I told everyone about how great their customer service and internet was.  The last 2 years it has been down more than it works.   Techs come out and their solution is always you need to pay us more and it will work.   I did do the upgrade and nothing changed.  So frustrating.

name: Jamie Leblanc
text:
I have to say the only good thing that comes from this provider are the 2 technicians I have had over the last four years and 2 customer support employees. We pay for 4mbps and for download we get 2 if that and upload is always less then 1mbps.  .7 mbps upload is as high as we normally get most of the time it's far less. Even after complaining multiple times, we where finally told the hardware for our area is to old to give us anymore then what we are getting. The employee who told us this also said the company was supposed to upgrade the equipment over 3 years back but never did. After learning this I thought about how much they have charged me over the years and never actually provided me with what they said.
I would not recommend using this provider if you can afford not to.

resp.text: Hi Jamie, we are very sorry for the trouble you've experienced. We'd like to look into this further and help. Please email us at social@consolidated.com. Thank you!

text: I wish I could give 0 stars! Unfortunately CenturyLink is the only internet provider where I live and the service is HORRIBLE! text: Worst internet provider I have ever dealt with. Wish I could give them 0 stars. Internet is incredibly slow.  We pay for 40 down and get barely 1 down. Customer service is the worst. We have to prove them wrong over and over again for them to retract their statement and send a tech. Once they set up a time for the tech, they cancel the tech visit without notifying us, saying it’s been resolved when nothing was resolved. We absolutely do not recommend this company to anyone at all, and if there was another option in our area we would switch to them in a heartbeat. What they do and how they treat their customers should be illegal.

text: Horrible service, have had to call multiple times to customer support which did NOT HELP AT ALL because they don’t even know what their technicians really do. We have had to tell them EXACTLY what was wrong for them to even send a technician to look at the problem. It has been over 20 days since we have had internet, the problem was simply a cable was cut during roadside construction. If I could give them a 0/5 star rating I would. Don’t try to get this service, they will argue with you when you have a problem with the service like an OUTAGE, they have a very outdated system that makes you wait forever anytime you request their services. I would never want anybody to have to waste their precious time with this disgusting company.

text:
My Spectrum experience has not been great since we moved here a year ago. We had difficulties and getting anyone to do anything about it was near impossible. Customer service was rude as was one of the Techs sent to the house. Issue finally resolved after many days, phone calls and techs in the home.
Fast forward to Sep 2020. Spectrum updating system and needed to pick up new box and self install by the 22nd. Went to the store only to find out boxes would not be in ghe store until the 22nd.
Called customer service, no problem, we’ll send one out. Box arrived, no instructions nor remote. Hooked it up with assistance of customer service, had picture for 5 minutes then went black screen. She made a same day apt for me.
Tech arrived, gave us a remote, worked awhile and got one channel working. Said it could take a day for everything to come up. Ten minutes after he left it went black screen. Several calls later got another apt. 8:30 at night I called because it was 2 hours passed the apt time. Told it was still opend. Told him to show in the morning. They called me at 9:23 pm when I was sleeping and since I didn’t answer the phone they cancelled work order.
Made another apt and it was cancelled for some reason.
Got connected with a supervisor in SC who got me a 5 pm apt. Tech showed up 10 to 5, said it probably needed rebooted, thst had been done numerous times. I told him he was supposed to bring a new box.
Didn’t have any, off to the store 10 minutes away to get one. After an hour I called and cancelled my service.
I’ve been thru way too much in my life to be treated like this.
Bottom line-
-Customer Service is there to make you feel good. They can’t do squat
-Supervises are there to tell you stuff to appease you and get you off there back, basicly lie to you.
-The techs that came in my home had no purpose being here.
As for me and my family, we choose books.

name: me to you
text:
Great experience. You are greated with a warm welcoming, "Welcome to Verizon" by Janet. This is a "corporate" store as opposed to a privately owned store further south on Hwy 59.
I guess that accounts for the "friendly and welcoming" service.

The personnel in the other store are rude, unwelcoming, and I witnessed the woman manager arguing with a woman customer.

This corporate store was friendly and helpful to everyone.  I thought Janet was the manager at the Corporate store because she has such a welcoming and caring work attitude. The woman manager never looked up, never said a word to me or anyone else that I noticed on my first visit to the store. Her focus was on a cell phone the entire time, but my second visit the next day, the manager was more active but not friendly nor did I see her greet anyone.

The young man, Justin, was helpful and very knowledgeable about cell phones.  He fixed what needed fixing right away.

I recommend Justin and Janet as your "go to person".  In Oct I plan to upgrade cell phone because this one is no longer made or sold. I guess 2011 to 2019 is good use for a cell phone. I could not get the charger to recharge it because of a frayed wire and a loose port. The 2 refurbished phones, so far, have been a pain. For 2 weeks I have had apps that do not open, then suddenly they open on their on accord.

He’s a very valuable asset!!!

Need to switch over to Verizon? See him!

text: Neat store with friendly employees! They have a good selection of new phones and cases. They're super willing to help you with whatever you need.

name: Paint Posse
text: This is by far the best Verizon store I have ever experienced, and I've been with Verizon too many years to count. The staff at this store is beyond helpful, making sure nobody waits too long if they can help it. Milton is a major asset to the company. This man knows how to multi-task like no one I've ever seen, all the while still making you feel like you are the only customer. As a small business owner, we all only wish we could employ people like Milton. His knowledge and patience paired with his gentleman-like friendly personality is truly something special. I never leave a review for anything unless I am overly impressed, and in this world, that is rare. I will go to this store for all my Verizon needs from now on.

resp.text: Hello, Lindsay. Thank you so much for taking the time to rate our Foley store.  We are thrilled to know your experience with us was 5 Star and Milton provided you with such excellent service.  We appreciate your feedback and value the opportunity to serve you!

name: Randall Strain
text: For years my wife used the Verizon owned store down the street from this store. She got tired of the wait lines and decided to use this store.  Since using this store her bill has fluctuated from month to month and no one there could or would tell us why. I was finally able to find out why. This store is a franchised store and your payment is not processed until the next day, and you will be stuck with a late fee.  If your bill is due by the 29th, you had better pay it on the 28th, because the store owner will not be honest about it. I remembered paying my bill at the company owned store down the street many times on the last day and never was I hit with a late charge. The Verizon owned store will get our business from now on.  They told me when I went there to get this info, honesty is the best policy, and their payments go in that very day. What a concept!!!

name: Blair White
text: Century Link is by far the worst internet service provider in Alabama and maybe in the southeast. If you live in Foley, AL, you have no choice but to go with Century Link for Internet service. You pay top dollar for extremely slow internet that doesn't work half the time especially after 6 pm on week days. It is mind blowing to me that in the year 2015, cable internet is not offered in Foley, AL. People think that I live in the middle of no where when I tell them that cable internet is not an option. But I just say no, I actually live right in the middle of a city. It's just a city that allows only one internet provider which is called a monopoly which is illegal!! Century Link and this monopoly is so ridiculous, my family and I would seriously consider moving just to get away from it! Which is completely unacceptable that we would have to do that!! Ugh I hate Century Link!!!!

name: Michael Hunt
text:
I have bonded DSL.  2 months no problem, satisfied with the service, but I don't have a contract so I am paying a ridiculous $85.00 a month for 15 down/2 up which has averaged in that area.  I am on a work site and don't need another contract to break so this was the way to go.  I have no phone.  Yesterday I had to create a skype number because of cell phone problems.  Guess what?  My internet is throttled today.  If I go to the "Century Link" speed test it shows I am pulling 15.1 down/1.51 up.  Of course I am not every other speed test shows with the closest local in Daphne AL at 2.46 down/ up 1.47.  In fact most of the other non centurylink speed test show a higher upload on about 1 then download.  I've reset the equipment and the desktop is directed wired.  The equipment is up and on par.
This is clearly throttling and should be illegal.  I've had no warning that I hit some limit.  Trying to located a real human to take to is impossible slow and hard to locate.  Do not use the worthless chat its a no go and a pawn in modern customer service.  I can't wait to get out of here and back home with Fiber optic.  The rural people better pay attention to the fish they elect that spawn with the corporate cows.  The internet is not a luxury for a mobile advanced society.  Get it regulated and make these suckers deliver what they are selling at high prices.

ONLY the screen protector. This place is a joke and the heavy set lady is rude and unprofessional. The day I went to get the phones I was there for 9 hours, yes 9 hours. They do not know what they are doing. Save your sanity and go to a different store. Now I've got to hire a lawyer to prove I'm not wrong. Unreal.

We just bought a home in the limits of Owens Cross Roads and the ONLY internet provider that provides for the area is New Hope Telephone CoOp. When the internet is working it is very nice. We have tried restarting the router and it's useless. We pay 75 dollars for the smallest internet package. It would be nice if it would actually work in our room, but 60% of the time it does not.

They gave us two wifi domains (I'm not sure about terminology) but 90% of the time only one is avaible. Which is extremely annoying.

Overall, I would not use this company but it is the only company we have as an option.   Sigh.

name: Daniel Martin
text:
Great and reliable service. I have just reviewed every telephone company in Alabama and all the people that take the time to write a review say they wish they had some other provider...kind of funny.  New Hope Telephone averages one hour trouble repair responses which is absolutely unheard of today, get that from AT&T, Comcast, Charter or any other provider, try 2 to 7 days from those companies.  Oh by the way it won't be long and we will have GIG internet availability as well...not bad from a rural provider when Birmingham, Mobile, Montgomery and Huntsville doesn't even have it yet.

The reason that NHTC is most people’s only ISP provider is the cost of operation and homes-per-mile available to serve. Other companies are free to serve the same area but choose not to due to the low profitability. NHTC isn’t a monopoly by choice but they are the only company that strives to provide service to an area that would otherwise not have it. That’s why telecom cooperatives were created by the people they serve. Great service and great employees!

resp.text: Thank you, Daniel!

text:
An excellent experience! They installed 4 in-ceiling speakers and 2 in-wall speakers for my man cave and I could not be happier. My wife thinks it looks great, too!

They listened and worked with me through the entire installation, making sure things were exactly like I wanted. I never felt rushed or pressured to make a decision.

You know the phrase, "Measure twice, cut once"? Well these guys measure 200 times, cut once! It simply looks great down here, I'm so very happy with their work.

I'm telling you guys, these folks know what they are doing for home AV installations. Thanks again to Gary and Tommy for working with me!

resp.text: We’re so glad you had such a great experience! Thank you for your business and positive review!

text: Can't begin to give enough thanks to Chad and his team for always being quick to respond, have the right answers and quickly solve whatever technology or  wiring project we've gotten stuck in and/or just plain over our heads. resp.text: Thank you for your business and kind words!

name: Travis Bender
text:
I've used Reliant Media for a variety of audio and visual jobs at Oak Mountain High School.  Some of the things they've recently done for us include:

1) Installing new LED lighting in our Performing Arts Center
2) Installing a new sound system in our band room and at our band practice field
3) Installing a new projector and screen (10' x 16') in our band room.

Chad and his crew at Reliant Media helped us develop a game plan to ensure our students would have the right equipment they need to be successful, delivered very competitive pricing, completed the work promptly, and followed up with us after installation to check that all electronics worked as needed.  I highly recommend this team of professionals.

resp.text: Thank you for your business and kind words!

text: Chad is our hero. He does all the lights for OMHS and we're going to go to him for sound equipment too. He worked out the best solution for our unique space and priced it in a variety of ways. Install was fast. Our new lights are gorgeous and we have five new working mics too!

name: Maggie
text:
I live in the middle of nowhere, and I'll put up with anything.
I'll sign up for some garbage internet service-
you know, I don't want to name an actual internet provider,
so let's just make one up; let's call it "Pinebelt Wireless".

So I'll sign up for "Pinebelt Wireless", and I'll turn on the router, and I'll go, "Can I get on the internet now, please?"
And they go, "No. We're fixing the towers."
And I go, "Okay!"
And then I do something else for a while.
And then I come back and I go, "Will it work now?" and they go,
"Yeah. But you won't be able to load video because we HATE you. Now go visit your websites, and only half the page will load, and the connection will drop in TEN MINUTES. Now go on, GET!"

And I go, "Okay" and I try to get on the internet,
and I go, "Can I download a file, please?"
and they go, "NO!"
and I go "Okay!"
and they go, "You're a little peasant aren't you?"
and I go, "no"
and they go "SAY IT!!"
and I go "I'm a little peasant"

And then I call Pinebelt Customer Service, which is an oxymoron, and I go, "Can I please find out why my internet doesn't work? When the towers will be fixed?"
And they go, "NO! In fact, we've given everyone else a free upgrade, but not you because your satisfaction is meaningless. You can't afford any other provider, so you'll have nothing, or you'll have the nothing that WE give you, and you will take the nothing that WE give you and YOU'LL LIKE IT."
and I go, "Why are you doing this to me?"
And they go, "Because we're Pinebelt Wireless, and life is a nightmare!"

text: This company continues to have zero regard for anyone's time or money spent on their sub-par services. in this Hoover, AL  large retail space with 7 customer service kiosks, 5 sit empty while 9 customers are in the store waiting. I stood waiting for one of the two staffed kiosks to open up then was rudely instructed that I would have to sign in to get help, I stated that I was just here to pick up equipment and again told "just sign in and wait." I was never greeted, or welcomed to the store. I've been waiting now for 45 minutes to pick up a "self-install" package to do their work myself since the company is so inadequate. You have to pay to self install your service by the way. In what other industry would this complete lack of competence be acceptable?  As I write this review, disgruntled customers are leaving the store because they have waited so long without even being greeted. This company shows a complete lack of customer service. This is likely why they are no longer an accredited business with the Better business bureau and have a BBB score of "F" I guess you are able to treat customers like this when you have a monopoly on these types of services. #cutcable #weneedanotheroption #Ijustwanttowatchfootball

name: Brooke Aloia
text: If I could give less than 1 star I would. Absolutely the worst customer service I’ve received. When I was called the woman assigned to me was on a personal phone call. I just had to return equipment that didn’t even work and that never allowed me to have internet to begin with. They still wanted me to pay the monthly bill. When I asked to talk to a supervisor I got, “ they’ll just tell you the same thing I did.” When I asked again I got “they’re not here.” It was like talking to a brick wall. She was extremely unhelpful and apparently there are no supervisors in that store at all and the employees just do what they want. That would at least explain why the employees are all on their phones and completely incompetent. I left and called their corporate number. Got my money back in 10min. I asked the customer service rep if this could’ve been done in store and he said it absolutely could have. Y’all I don’t even normally care about stuff like this but this place is COMPLETE TRASH. Some one needs to do an overhaul of this place. Stay away from these guys.

text: Went into the Hoover, AL location today (10.10.2020) to replace an iPhone XR that I broke. A short 5 minute wait later, Drea (I think that was her name) calls me up to assist me. I explained to her my situation and let her know I had an unlocked phone in my pocket but didn’t know if it was going to work. When I showed it to her she told me it wouldn’t, which I already knew would be her answer because it was an older non popular phone. Anyway as I was debating getting another phone, this little beautiful ray of sunshine named Jhayla Morton said she had an extra phone that wasn’t needed and that I could have it. Now I was already having a bad day and looking rough lol, but little does she know, she completely turned my day around and made it brighter with her kind gesture. She passed Drea the phone and she got it setup with my SIM card , and I was good to go. I really appreciate all the help I received at Spectrum today. Everyone was nice, friendly and created a welcoming atmosphere. I will always go back to this location. Thank you Jhayla.

name: Matt Coder
text:
On Friday, May 15th 2020, I was in my home minding my own business when I heard the doorbell. I went to the door, and saw a charter spectrum agent named Eric Proladocfer standing at the door. I answered the door to ask what he needed. He started to try to sell his products to me. In the middle of his spiel, he spat in the middle of my yard……that’s right….he spat in the middle of my yard while a pandemic is running wild through the country. I got his information, and contacted the charter spectrum location on 5543 Grove Blvd, Hoover, AL 35226.

At this time, I spoke to who was supposed to be Eric’s manager, Chris Davis. I told Chris about what happened, and he said that he would talk to his manager about the incident (I thought he was the manager?) and get back to me no later than Monday (05/18/2020) afternoon. I never received a call from anyone. Now, I’m leaving this review. I guess this company doesn’t care about their employees spitting on people’s property…..even during a pandemic. Hopefully the kids in the neighborhood that play in my yard sometimes didn’t step in it.

name: Karen Tennyson
text: I came to this store to switch my phone from Sprint to Spectrum..The first trip was at 6 pm. My phone was unlocked and all i needed was a SIM card and to have phone activated... Their computer hadn't been taking payments all day? They don't accept cash? So.... was told they would order me a SIM card? and I would have it in 2-3 days? Told her I would be back the next day. 2 hours later my payment was taken out of my account... Went back the next morning---Explained my situation.. Was told they couldn't help me since SIM card was ordered? Gave me a number to call.. Was on phone for 2 HOURS.. With no assistance from store employees... I was finally given another SIM card but they couldnt help me activate my phone..... Rep on phone was helpful but said there was a problem and had to issue a trouble ticket?  Left the store which was overcrowded with customers and only 1 employee to assist them ... Very poorly managed store... Other customers had waited 30 minutes or longer... Called activation number that night... Very friendly rep and had my phone activated within 15 minutes.... I will never go to the location again....There needs to be more diversity in choosing employees....

name: Shaun Capps
text: On this particular visit, I needed to swap a remote. There were a number of customers waiting for various reasons so I was concerned that there would be a long wait. However, one staff member walking by seemed to notice that I had the remote and asked if I just needed to swap it. I told her yes and she immediately swapped the remote and I was on my way. Less than 5 minutes in the store.  I was very pleased with the service I received on this visit.

name: Sean Pugeda
text: Generally my experience with Charter has been awful, but this store has wonderful employees working for it. Charter should be thankful they have amazing employees like Andrea working for them. Thank you for turning around a very sour experience!

text: Only 2 employees for too much costumer

text: these people are very and confident I went into the store to take my name off my old account and put my son name on there but instead they put my son name on my new account and left me on all the count even though we presented than what I driver's license the correct address with everything need to go we filled out all the paperwork they told us to fill out and yet we sign it and they put it on. When I call them to explain to them that they messed up that's a No-No there's nothing we can do about it you have to go back into the store and show them your driver's license so that we can switch names even though we can look on both accounts and see that the names are in the wrong position oops sorry for the inconvenience

text: They need to have a more efficient process for customers just picking up a router.  It’s a little silly to make customers wait for all the folks with problems that need solving. Then there was another whom I think is in management she was just walking around not doing nothing and the only thing she says to the customers is “if you have to pay a bill you can use the machine”!!  Before I finally decided to leave there were approximately 16 people waiting and most of them had equipment to turn back in!! I will not be going back because that is Inexcusable!!

Wait times take up to an hour or more just to return equipment. There are 7 desks and only 2 maybe 3 people working them at a time. I would avoid this place at all costs, but they keep closing their other locations and make it harder to find a store.

text:
Staff is very slow. This location is understaffed and many employees seem to need help for what seems to be the simplest of requests.  Cross training would benefit this store. Customers should plan on staying for at least an hour for any requests, even for something as minor as dropping off equipment.

Tips to store management: if you want to use a kiosk, make sure it works or otherwise have better "sign in signage", more seating is necessary, customer DIY options would be helpful (fill out this form and drop your stuff in our box or, use our kiosk to order service/supplies - a machine may be smarter than some of your staff!)

text: I waited for someone to say may I help you? I was the only waiting customer. Instead I waited while several Spectrum workers talked to the only other customer in the store at this time! Like I had all day. I said Loudly, "Excuse me I used to brag on this store for not having you wait". They looked at me and continued to ignore me. Another Spectrum Customer Service Rep came from the back & did call me up but after a few minutes she ran into a problem. So she asked her co-worker she said was her supervisor who was involved in this private conversation going on with the Only other customer. I had to continue to wait and listen to the supervisor talk to someone else concerning starting some kindergarten business! After my rep asked for her assistance. Like I had Nothing else to do! It was Awful! I had a 92 year old waiting in the car! Then All 3 reverted to the back. About 4 more customers came in and was just waiting I know for about five minutes before she finished her helping me. My rep was the only representative assisting customers when I left. The others was in the back while customers waited! Just abusive customer service.

name: Lisa N
text:
It’s been 3 days and my service has still not been connected.
First, the apartment and Spectrum have a ‘deal’ with each other. The apartment charges the tenant $30 extra in the rent for basic cable service. Then in order to set that up you have to call Spectrum to get the connection set up. Additional fees for the internet and WiFi to be paid directly by the tenant at a rate of upwards of $69 or more....
Appointment Friday - guy connects internet box to wall and leaves.... no connection to tv???
Oh yeah, you have to GO AND GET YOUR cable box from the local store.... technicians don’t bring those like with a residential install I guess....
New appointment for 6-7 pm Saturday evening-no one shows up, even after 4 calls to Spectrum and them so-called escalating the issue....Then in the wee hours of Sunday morning they send an auto generated email for a RESCHEDULED appointment for 8-9 PM!!!
No phone call, no apology-NOTHING.
I Call Sunday morning 10:00 am - I was told that was a placeholder appointment but that my appointment was a MUST DO and that as soon as the technician is free, he will call with ETA...
This is by far the worst customer service. If I could cancel I would. But this is a secondary residence with my college daughters who need WiFi to further their education. However on  my primary account I will be switching from Spectrum.  I I could rate lower than one Star I would.

name: Russ Daly
text:
After an extremely poor experience at the Verizon TCC store in Alexander City, I called and spoke with Rob at Verizon- Cellular Sales, who was very polite in explaining Verizon's new security process. He even apologized for the bad experience in AC!
I was so impressed with him, I drove 30 miles to purchase a new phone from him. When my wife and I arrived, Rob wasn't there, so Jeff served us. He was extremely polite, courteous and respectful. He took the time to thoroughly explain everything to us and never once appeared bothered by our questions. He went the extra mile in helping us find what we were looking for at a reasonable price. Jeff made the entire experience worthwhile.
I highly recommend this store and their staff!

resp.text: Russ, thanks for that shout out! You just made our day. We’re always on the lookout for ways to better serve Cellular Sales customers and you’re helping us to serve even better. We appreciate you! -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

Today I came in because my home phone box wasn't receiving calls or calling out. Adam helped me reset it and got me on a plan with unlimited data so that I never get charged for using too much. He told me about a promotion too that I might do later.
